name: Relativistic Length Contraction Calculator
description: Calculate length contraction effects at relativistic speeds using Einstein's special relativity. Input rest length and velocity to compute the contracted length.

howTo.name: How to Calculate Relativistic Length Contraction
howTo.description: Step-by-step instructions for calculating length contraction effects at relativistic speeds

step.text: Enter the rest length of the object in meters
step.name: Enter rest length

step.text: Enter the velocity in kilometers per second (km/s)
step.name: Enter velocity

step.text: Click the Calculate button to compute the contracted length
step.name: Calculate

step.text: View the results showing the contracted length relative to the speed of light (299,792.458 km/s)
step.name: View results

about.name: Special Relativity
about.description: Einstein's theory describing how measurements of space and time are relative to the velocity of the observer
